evidence.pdf_reference: under saturated CO 2 atmosphere and visible light ( 420 nm), with Ru(bpy) 3 Cl 2 6H 2 O (denoted as Ru) and triethanolamine (TEOA) as photosensitizer and electron donor, respectively.As expected, CSH-Pb bearing non-transition metal is inert for CO 2 reduction (Fig. 5a).In addition, CSH-Cu, CSH-Zn, and CSH-Ni show an enormous difference in gas yield.There is very little gas generating for CSH-Cu and CSH-Zn, whereas CSH-Ni has superior photocatalytic activity over other samples.The CO yield reaches to 17.11

addition, only 0.13 mol of CH 4 is generated and no H 2 can be detected, resulting in high CO selectivity (99.2).It was shown that H 2 O adsorption energy is low and the free energy of hydrogen evolution is high for Ni 2 , which can greatly suppress competing hydrogen evolution reaction (HER) 17,18.These factors decide the high selectivity of CSH-Ni.The comparison between CSH-Ni and the state-ofthe-art photocatalysts is provided in Table S4.The CO yield and selectivity with CSH-Ni as a photocatalyst are

Abstract
Recycling harmful heavy metals for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction. Proposing an "adsorbent-to-photo- catalyst" strategy. Calcium silicate hydrate ultrathin na- nosheets as an ideal adsorbent.
Experimental

to perform photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.The process was repeated three times and the gas yield was recorded.To compensate the transfer loss of photocatalysts, more sample (2 mg) was added into initial reaction solutions. Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns were recorded on a desktop X-ray diffractometer (RIGAKU-Miniflex II) with Cu K radiation ( 1.5406A).N 2 and CO 2 adsorption and desorption isotherms were measured at 77 K and 298 K on a physisorption analyser (Micromeritics, ASAP 2020).The samples

under the same catalysis conditions except that the 12 CO 2 gas was replaced by 13 CO 2 .The reduction products were analysed by a gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS, Agilent 7890B and Agilent 5977B MSD).To evaluate stability of catalysts, the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was performed for 2 h at first.And then, the photocatalysts were separated from reaction solutions by centrifugation.After washing and drying, they were re-dispersed into fresh reaction solutions to perform photocatalytic CO 2

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: (UV-Vis) absorption spectra were recorded by an UV-Vis spectrometer (Lambda 950) equipped with an integrating sphere accessory in the diffuse reflectance mode (R).BaSO 4 was used as a reference material.Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were recorded on a fluorescence spectrometer (HORIBA, FluoroMax-4). of CH 3 CN:H 2 O:TEOA 3:2:1 (volvol).The reaction setup was alternately vacuum degassed and purged with CO 2 three times, after which high-purity CO 2 was purged again for 30 min.The reaction solution was stirred and irradiated under a 300 W Xenon lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter.The temperature was controlled at 301-303 K by circulating cooling water and heater.The gaseous product was analysed by a gas chromatography (Agilent 7890B). The 13 CO 2 isotopic experiment was performed under the same catalysis
